text: The 1913–14 international cricket season was from September 1913 to April 1914. ==Season overview== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="7" |International tours |- ! rowspan="2" |Start date ! rowspan="2" |Home team ! rowspan="2" |Away team ! colspan="4" |Results [Matches] |- !Test !ODI !FC !LA |- | | | |0–4 [5] |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |- | | | |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |2–1 [4] |; style="text-align:center"| — |- | | | |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |0–2 [2] |; style="text-align:center"| — |} ==December== ===England in South Africa=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="9"|Test series |- ! No. ! Date ! Home captain ! Away captain ! Venue ! Result |- | Test 130 || 13–17 December || Herbie Taylor || Johnny Douglas || Lord's No. 1 Ground, Cape Town || by an innings and 157 runs |- | Test 131 || 26–30 December || Herbie Taylor || Johnny Douglas || Old Wanderers, Johannesburg || by an innings and 12 runs |- | Test 132 || 1–5 January || Herbie Taylor || Johnny Douglas || Old Wanderers, Johannesburg || by 91 runs |- | Test 133 || 14–18 February || Herbie Taylor || Johnny Douglas || Lord's No. 1 Ground, Cape Town || Match drawn |- | Test 134 || 27 Feb–3 March || Herbie Taylor || Johnny Douglas || Crusaders Ground, Durban || by 10 wickets |} === New Zealand in Australia === {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="9"|First-class Series |- ! No. ! Date ! Home captain ! Away captain ! Venue ! Result |- | Match 1 || 19–22 December || William Evans || Dan Reese || The Gabba, Brisbane || by 12 runs |- | Match 2 || 26–27 November || Victor Trumper || Dan Reese || Sydney Cricket Ground, Sydney || by an innings and 247 runs |- | Match 3 || 9–10 January || Warwick Armstrong || Dan Reese || Melbourne Cricket Ground, Melbourne || by an innings and 110 runs |- | Match 4 || 16–19 January || Clem Hill || Dan Reese || Adelaide Oval, Adelaide || Match drawn |} ==March== === Australia in New Zealand === {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="9"|Three-day Match Series |- ! No. ! Date ! Home captain ! Away captain ! Venue ! Result |- | Test 186 || 6–9 March || Dan Reese || Monty Noble || Carisbrook, Dunedin || Sims' XI by won by 7 wickets |- | Test 190 || 27–30 March || Lancelot Hemus || Arthur Sims || Eden Park, Auckland || Sims' XI by an innings and 113 runs |} ==References== Category:International cricket competitions by season Category:1913 in cricket Category:1914 in cricket
title: International cricket in 1913–14
